snippet: Prime Minister Erdogan should not be appeased in his silencing of all satire and criticism by leveraging refugee relief against Chancellor Merkel.
abstract: Editorial questions decision by German Chancellor Angela Merkel to allow case against satirist Jan Bohmermann, based on obscure law forbidding ridicule of foreign leaders, to proceed at request of Turkish Prime Min Recep Tayyip Erdogan; notes Erdogan demanded prosecution of comedian, who had ridiculed him, in return for upholding deal to address migrant crisis; suggests acceding to Erdogan's demand is akin to paying kidnapping ransom, creating potentially risky precedent.
lead_paragraph: Prime Minister Erdogan should not be appeased in his silencing of all satire and criticism by leveraging refugee relief against Chancellor Merkel.

headline.print_headline: Sending the Wrong Signal to Turkey
headline.main: Sending the Wrong Signal to Turkey
